title: What is an OBB file in Android? - Quora

response.answer_text: An OBB file is an expansion file used by some Android apps distributed using the Google Play online store. It contains data that is not stored in the application's main package (.APK file), such as graphics, media files, and other large program assets. OBB files are often stored in a device's shared storage folder. See also: What does an OBB file contain (for Android games)? How can I install OBB/data file on an Android?
